Posts.Content: thesuiteshoppe wrote: Forgive me if this has addressed, I couldn't find it in the forums.  I just finished my first round of chemo for breast cancer.  I had that shot to stimulate white blood cell growth in my bone marrow.  Was told to take Tylenol and Zyrtec for the pain.  I had something stronger, Hydrocodone from the port surgery so was told to continue taking that instead if still needed.  Still needed, as port was still very painful.  Shot was given Monday afternoon, by this afternoon (Tuesday), pain was at an 8 or so out of 10 so called the triage nurse who took 2 1/2 hours to call back, then another 1/2 hour to discuss with doc.  They're doing nothing.  Telling me to take a hot bath.  This is insulting to me.  What's with Utah docs??  I was given nothing for the port pain when I left the hospital and my cancer doc ended up prescribing something to control that.  Now that doc tells me I don't need anything for bone marrow pain.  WTF?  Any experience here?  Any suggestions?  Are they concerned with addiction?   I've had many many surgeries in my life and I've never had addiction problems.. oxycodone, Loritab, never a problem.  Suddenly though my pain isn't being taken seriously and I'm only on treatment number one.  I cannot complete this regimen if they aren't going to treat the pain appropriately.  Any help will be appreciated.  Thanks! Dx 6/22/2011, DCIS, 4cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Doctor non responsive to pain thesuiteshoppe ma111
